item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 8, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. An open discussion forum for ArXiv papers (299 points | 94 comments)
2. Concrete clickbait: next time you share a spomenik photo, think abt what it mean (2016) (77 points | 37 comments)
3. LibrePythonista allows running IPython code in a LibreOffice spreadsheet (31 points | 1 comment)
4. PC Floppy Copy Protection: Softguard Superlok (47 points | 14 comments)
5. How a 16th Century Explorer's Sailing Ship Works (79 points | 17 comments)
6. Asking the wrong questions (2017) (156 points | 79 comments)
7. WebP: The WebPage Compression Format (470 points | 163 comments)
8. Baiting the bot (96 points | 47 comments)
9. Cracking an old ZIP file to help open source the ANC's "Vula" secret crypto code (259 points | 25 comments)
10. Have ‘hobby’ apps become the new social networks? (110 points | 115 comments)
11. Cruise ships chopped in half are a license to print money (196 points | 170 comments)
12. CitizenDJ – Make music using free audio and video from the Library of Congress (191 points | 12 comments)
13. Keyhole – Forge own Windows Store licenses (588 points | 263 comments)
14. Microui+fenster=Small GUI (146 points | 16 comments)
15. Dogs can remember names of toys years after not seeing them, study shows (273 points | 154 comments)
16. A new rare high-rank elliptic curve, and an orchard of Diophantine equations (187 points | 17 comments)
17. Going Buildless (13 points | 4 comments)
18. Battlestar Galactica: Technical Manual (2005) (59 points | 39 comments)
19. The "email is authentication" pattern (249 points | 350 comments)
20. LuaJIT PR: Add Support for RISC-V 64 (58 points | 15 comments)
21. Appalachian Trail Hiker Photo Archive (132 points | 28 comments)
22. Early science and stone engineering in Menga, a Neolithic dolmen (25 points | 1 comment)
23. UK electric car drivers should be charged per mile, say campaigners (3 points | 1 comment)
24. Beyond Ctrl-C: The dark corners of Unix signal handling (130 points | 45 comments)
25. A day in the life of the fastest supercomputer (16 points | 13 comments)
26. Hallelujah, Leonard Cohen, and a Pulitzer Prize-winning writer's suicide (147 points | 88 comments)
27. Things to know about the Great Wave (254 points | 82 comments)
28. GPT-fabricated scientific papers on Google Scholar (182 points | 93 comments)
29. The little-known life of the scarfing tool (2003) (16 points | 2 comments)
30. How to wrap a C compiler and preprocessor, really (63 points | 3 comments)
